p:
A total of 791 specimens were studied (
Table 1 ), which included 488 (61.7%) collected in 2016, and 303 (38.3%) individuals collected in 2017. Aedes albopictus was the most abundant mosquito species in all locations (n = 709; 89.6%), followed by Ae. aegypti (n = 62; 7.8%), and Cx. pipiens sensu lato (n = 20; 2.5%). Females comprised 91.4% (723 / 791) of the study cohort. Sampling sites in Artvin province provided 59.3% of the specimens (n = 496), followed by Rize (n = 192, 24.3%) and Trabzon (n = 130, 16.4%) provinces. Aedes albopictus and Cx. pipiens s.l. were detected in all provinces sampled, but Ae. aegypti was not detected in the collection sites in Trabzon province (
Table 1 ).
